NCIM Units Library¶

Not Crashing Into Mars (NCIM) is a simple lightweight units library for gamegine

Generic NCIM Functions¶

gamegine.utils.NCIM.ncim.RatioOf(a, b)[source]¶

Returns the ratio of two values. Primarily for backwards compatibility with functions which already use this function.

Parameters:

  • a (float) – The numerator of the ratio.

  • b (float) – The denominator of the ratio.

Returns:

The ratio of the two values.

Return type:

float

gamegine.utils.NCIM.ncim.Zero()[source]¶

Returns a zero spatial measurement.

Returns:

A zero value of the default dimension.

Return type:

Dimension

Base Measurements¶

class gamegine.utils.NCIM.basic.ComplexDimension(dimension: ndarray)[source]¶

A class representing a complex dimension. Stores information about dimensionality of a unit or measurement in the form of an array of powers of dimensions. Wraps a numpy array to allow for easy manipulation and comparison of dimensions.

Parameters:

dimension (np.ndarray) – The dimension of the unit or measurement.

from_base(value: float, map: ComplexDimensionMap) → ndarray[source]¶

Converts a value from the base unit in the same dimension to the unit.

Parameters:

  • value (float) – The value to convert.

  • map (ComplexDimensionMap) – The mapping of dimensions to units.

Returns:

The converted value.

Return type:

float

classmethod zeroes(length: int)[source]¶

Returns a dimension with all values set to zero.

Parameters:

length (int) – The length of the dimension.

Returns:

The zeroed dimension.

Return type:

ComplexDimension

class gamegine.utils.NCIM.basic.ComplexDimensionMap(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

A class representing a mapping of dimensions to singular units. Contains information which maps dimensions to units, allowing for maintaining provided units in the creation of ComplexUnit and ComplexMeasurement objects.

Parameters:

units (Dict[Unit, int]) – The mapping of dimensions to units.

get_symbol(dimension: ComplexDimension) → str[source]¶

Returns the symbol of the dimension, based on the degrees of dimensions in the provided ComplexDimension. For example, meters per second squared would be represented with a symbol of m/s^2.

Parameters:

dimension (ComplexDimension) – The dimension to get the symbol for.

Returns:

The symbol of the dimension.

Return type:

str

merge_with(other: ComplexDimensionMap) → None[source]¶

Merges the mapping with another mapping. If a dimension is not present in the current mapping, it is added. This is used when performing operations between different ComplexMeasurement objects.

Parameters:

other (ComplexDimensionMap) – The other mapping to merge with.

class gamegine.utils.NCIM.basic.ComplexMeasurement(magnitude: float, unit: ComplexUnit, base_magnitude=None, dimension=None, dimension_map=None)[source]¶

A class representing a complex measurement, which is defined with a magnitude and a complex unit. Contains information about the dimension and unit of the measurement. Represents a value in multiple dimensions, such as 5 meters per second squared or 10 Nm.

Parameters:

  • magnitude (float) – The magnitude of the measurement.

  • unit (ComplexUnit) – The unit of the measurement.

  • base_magnitude (float, optional) – The magnitude of the measurement in the base unit of the same dimension. Used for internal creations.

  • dimension (ComplexDimension, optional) – The dimension of the measurement, used for internal creations.

  • dimension_map (ComplexDimensionMap, optional) – The mapping of dimensions to units, used for internal creations.

get_dimension()[source]¶

Returns the dimension of the measurement.

Returns:

The dimension of the measurement.

Return type:

ComplexDimension

get_unit_magnitude() → float[source]¶

Returns the magnitude of the measurement in the unit.

Returns:

The magnitude of the measurement in the unit.

Return type:

float

to(unit: ComplexUnit) → float[source]¶

Converts the measurement to a different unit.

Parameters:

unit (ComplexUnit) – The unit to convert to.

Returns:

The converted measurement.

Return type:

float

to_complex()[source]¶

Returns the complex measurement object, used for the purposes of interoperability between Measurement and ComplexMeasurement objects.

class gamegine.utils.NCIM.basic.ComplexUnit(units: Dict[Unit, int])[source]¶

A class representing a complex unit, defined as being made up of multiple dimensions with arbitrary powers, such as meters per second squared. Contains information about scale and shift in relation to a base unit in the same dimension to allow for conversions. Used during the initial creation of a ComplexMeasurement and for converting out of a base ComplexMeasurement.

Parameters:

units (Dict[Unit, int]) – The mapping of dimensions to powers.

from_base(value: float) → float[source]¶

Converts from the base value to the ComplexUnit. Additionally, the value is rounded in order to prevent floating point errors.

get_dimension() → ComplexDimension[source]¶

Returns the dimension of the unit.

Returns:

The dimension of the unit.

Return type:

Dimension

get_dimension_map() → ComplexDimensionMap[source]¶

Returns copy of the mapping of dimensions to units.

Returns:

The mapping of dimensions to units.

Return type:

ComplexDimensionMap

to_base(value: float) → float[source]¶

Converts a value from the ComplexUnit to the base unit in the same dimension. Additionally, the value is rounded in order to prevent floating point errors.

Parameters:

value (float) – The value to convert.

Returns:

The converted value.

Return type:

float

class gamegine.utils.NCIM.basic.Measurement(magnitude: float, unit: Unit, base_magnitude=None)[source]¶

A class representing a simple measurement, defined as a value with a unit. Contains information about the dimension and unit of the measurement. Represent a value in a single dimension, such as 5 meters or 10 seconds.

Parameters:

  • magnitude (float) – The magnitude of the measurement.

  • unit (Unit) – The unit of the measurement.

  • base_magnitude (float, optional) – The magnitude of the measurement in the base unit of the same dimension. Used for internal conversions.

get_dimension() → Dimension[source]¶

Returns the dimension of the measurement.

Returns:

The dimension of the measurement.

Return type:

Dimension

get_unit() → Unit[source]¶

Returns the unit of the measurement.

Returns:

The unit of the measurement.

Return type:

Unit

get_unit_magnitude() → float[source]¶

Returns the magnitude of the measurement in the unit.

Returns:

The magnitude of the measurement in the unit.

Return type:

float

to(unit: Unit) → float[source]¶

Converts the measurement to a different unit.

Parameters:

unit (Unit) – The unit to convert to.

Returns:

The converted measurement.

Return type:

float

class gamegine.utils.NCIM.basic.Unit(dimension: Dimension, scale: float = 0, symbol='', shift: float = 0)[source]¶

A class representing a simple unit, defined as being made up of a single dimension with a power of 1, such as meters or seconds. Contains information about scale and shift in relation to a base unit in the same dimension to allow for conversions.

Parameters:

  • dimension (Dimension) – The dimension of the unit.

  • scale (float, optional) – The scale of the unit in relation to an arbitrary base unit in the same dimension.

  • symbol (str, optional) – The symbol of the unit.

  • shift (float, optional) – The shift of the unit in relation to the base unit in the same dimension.

from_base(value: float) → float[source]¶

Converts a value from the base unit in the same dimension to the unit. Additionally, the value is rounded in order to prevent floating point errors.

Parameters:

value (float) – The value to convert.

Returns:

The converted value.

Return type:

float

get_dimension() → Dimension[source]¶

Returns the dimension of the unit.

Returns:

The dimension of the unit.

Return type:

Dimension

get_scale()[source]¶

Returns the scale of the unit.

Returns:

The scale of the unit.

Return type:

float

get_symbol() → str[source]¶

Returns the symbol of the unit. Used when printing measurements.

Returns:

The symbol of the unit.

Return type:

str

to_base(value: float) → float[source]¶

Converts a value from the unit to the base unit in the same dimension. Additionally, the value is rounded in order to prevent floating point errors.

Parameters:

value (float) – The value to convert.

Returns:

The converted value.

Return type:

float

Spatial¶

class gamegine.utils.NCIM.Dimensions.spatial.SpatialMeasurement(magnitude: float, unit: Unit, base_magnitude=None)[source]¶

A class representing a spatial measurement

Parameters:

  • magnitude (float) – The magnitude of the measurement.

  • unit (SpatialUnit) – The unit of the measurement.

  • base_magnitude (float, optional) – The base magnitude of the measurement, used for internal creation. Defaults to None.

class gamegine.utils.NCIM.Dimensions.spatial.SpatialUnit(scale: float = 0, display='', shift: float = 0)[source]¶

A class representing a spatial unit of measurement, in addition to creating a SpatialMeasurement of the same type when called. Inherits from the Unit class.

Parameters:

  • scale (float, optional) – The scale of the unit.

  • display (str, optional) – The display name of the unit.

  • shift (float, optional) – The shift of the unit.
